channel.title: Red Hat Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [RHAISTRAT-193] Extend Training Dashboard to Support RayJobs
item.description:
Overview

This RFE proposes extending the Red Hat OpenShift AI training dashboard to include RayJobs alongside the existing model training workloads. Currently, the dashboard shows various training jobs but lacks visibility into Ray-based distributed computing workloads, which are increasingly important for large-scale AI/ML tasks.

 

Business Justification

Problem Statement

  • Limited Visibility: Users cannot monitor RayJobs through the existing RHOAI training dashboard
  • Fragmented Experience: Ray workloads require separate monitoring tools, breaking the unified AI platform experience
  • Operational Complexity: Administrators need multiple interfaces to manage distributed AI workloads
  • Missing Integration: Ray is a critical component for distributed ML training, inference, and data processing

Value Proposition

  • Unified Dashboard: Single pane of glass for all distributed AI workloads (traditional training + Ray)
  • Enhanced User Experience: Consistent UI/UX for monitoring different workload types
  • Improved Observability: Better visibility into resource utilization across all AI workload types
  • Operational Efficiency: Reduced context switching for platform administrators and data scientists

Proposed Solution

Core Requirements

1. RayJob Integration

  • Display RayJobs in the same unified workload list alongside existing training jobs
  • Ray-specific Metadata: Show Ray cluster information, head/worker pod counts, Ray version
  • Ray Status Mapping: Map Ray job states to existing dashboard status indicators
  • Resource Tracking: Display Ray cluster resource utilization (CPU, memory, GPU)

2. Enhanced UI Components

Workload Type Indicator
  • Add workload type column or badge to distinguish:
  • Traditional Training Jobs (PyTorchJob, TensorFlowJob, etc.)
  • RayJobs (Ray training, serving, data processing)
  • Other Distributed Workloads (future extensibility)
Ray-Specific Details
  • Ray Cluster Info: Head node, worker nodes, cluster status
  • Ray Dashboard Link: Deep link to Ray dashboard for detailed monitoring
  • Resource Allocation: Ray-specific resource requests/limits
  • Job Type Classification: Training, serving, data processing, custom

3. Filtering and Search

  • Workload Type Filter: Allow filtering by job type (Training, RayJob, All)
  • Ray-Specific Search: Search by Ray cluster name, Ray job name
  • Status Filtering: Include Ray-specific statuses

4. Action Support

  • Ray Job Actions: Start, stop, restart RayJobs from dashboard
  • Resource Scaling: Adjust Ray cluster worker counts
  • Log Access: Quick access to Ray job logs and metrics

Acceptance Criteria

  1. Dashboard Integration: RayJobs appear in training dashboard with appropriate metadata
  2. Status Accuracy: Ray job statuses accurately reflect actual Ray cluster states
  3. Resource Visibility: Ray cluster resource information is clearly displayed
  4. Action Support: Basic Ray job lifecycle actions work correctly
  5. Performance: Dashboard load times remain acceptable with mixed workloads
  6. User Testing: Data scientists can effectively monitor Ray workloads through dashboard

Risk Assessment

Technical Risks

  • Performance Impact: Additional data queries for Ray information
  • Complexity: Managing different workload types in unified interface
  • Ray Operator Dependency: Reliance on KubeRay operator stability
item.summary: Extend Training Dashboard to Support RayJobs

status.description: Work is being scoped and discussed (To Do status category; see also Draft)

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: 100% To Do, 0% In Progress, 0% Done
